On 9/2/05, Matt Ittigson <cydatamatt@...> wrote:
> On 9/2/05, stack <=
stack@...> wrote:
> >
> > ... you can watch the URLs as they go thr=
ough the scope.  Will help you
> > debug.
> 
> Done exactly as suggested.

=
Where would I go about watching this?  It seems pertinent given the
informa=
tion below.

> > (You'll also likely need the aforementioned alternate queu=
e assignment
> > policy).
> > Good luck,
> 
> 1,146,463 URLs loaded via the=
 importUris JMX command with the heap
> climbing to 1,869,072 KB.  I just s=
tarted the job and I'll keep y'all
> apprised of the memory situation as it=
 runs.

Before running out of memory, the final statiscal count was 151889
=
downloads out of 4473197 potential (the bar graph on the summary
page).  Th=
e problem, as I see it, is that the 4.4M number should never
have been that=
 high.  After I loaded the 1.1M seeds, the number of
potential pages was ar=
ound twice that (I'm guessing because of DNS?). 
Because the attempt was to=
 configure Heritrix to not download any
pages but the seeds, clearly someth=
ing has gone wrong.  The extra
pages being scheduled is what is driving the=
 memory needs up.  As I
see it, Heritrix's memory should already be close t=
o the max necessary
after the seed load, assuming this method works.

I set=
 the parameter:

org.archive.crawler.deciderules.DecideRuleSequence.level=
=3DFINE

But there doesn't appear to be any useful information in the
herit=
rix_out.log file (I guess I could be looking for the wrong thing,
since the=
 file is 2.8G).  Suggestions for next efforts?

Thanks for your help.

-mat=
t
